definition: extra/surplus/remaining/remainder after division/(following numerical value) or more/in excess of (some number)/residue (math.)/after/I/me
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: There is still money left in the hands of people and is finding way out.
sentences.chinese: 大家手中的餘錢還在那兒，總要找出路。

sentences.english: All his spare time goes on books.
sentences.chinese: 他所有的餘錢都花在書本上。

sentences.english: It was a cold snowy night. And I had no money left for food.
sentences.chinese: 那是個寒冷的下雪夜，我又沒餘錢買食物。

sentences.english: After paying the rent, he barely has any money left to maintain his living.
sentences.chinese: 付完房租後，他幾乎沒有餘錢來維持生活。

sentences.english: Retirement savings is one of the first things to go because it is discretionary.
sentences.chinese: 退休儲蓄是你要考慮的頭等大事之一，因爲你有餘錢。

sentences.english: Fifth, put most of the extra money you now have into savings.
sentences.chinese: 第五步，把手上大部分餘錢存起來。

sentences.english: Xia spends her weekends, and her family's spare cash, attending tutoring sessions to help prepare her for the examination.
sentences.chinese: 她用家裏的餘錢參加週末的補習班，幫助自己備考。

sentences.english: The cooling-off property market leads to more spare cash in the hands of the public to support spending.
sentences.chinese: 樓市不熱反令市民手上餘錢增多，支持消費。

sentences.english: Families have enough spare to welcome them home.
sentences.chinese: 他們的家庭也有餘錢歡迎他們回來。
